reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Combined grant to support HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis & Malaria programs and Health Systems in Afghanistan

description.narrative: Afghanistan - Multicomponent - United Nations Development Programme - UNDP Afghanistan. This program has the following goals: The goal of the NSP IV is to halt new HIV, STI & Hepatitis infections and improve the health and quality of life of people living with and affected by HIV, STIs, and Hepatitis in Afghanistan over the next five years.. To reduce TB deaths by 75% by the end of 2025 compared to 2015. To ensure that Afghanistan is on track to eliminate malaria by 2030 – contributing towards country development and the Sustainable Development Goals. To decrease TB incidence rate by 20% by 2024 (to reach 50% reduction in incidence rate compared to 2015) in order to be aligned with End TB Strategy. To strengthen the health system to reduce mortality and morbidity associated with ATM and RMNCH. The objectives of this program are: To focus strategically on prevention services for HIV and other infections for key populations (PWID, MHRB, WHRB and prisoners). To increase the case notification of all TB cases at least 12% annually until 2023 and maintain full coverage thereafter, and to sustain treatment success rate, at least, 90% by 2025. Reducing the reported malaria incidence by 73% at the national level compared with 2016. To increase the coverage and quality of opiod substitution therapy for people who inject drugs by 2023. To detect and treat at least 80% of estimated MDR-TB cases by 2025. Interrupting indigenous transmission of malaria in 23 Provinces (Badghis, Baghlan, Farah, Ghor, Hirat, Jawzjan, Kabul, Kunduz, Nimroz, Parwan, Samangan, Balkh, Bamyan, Dykundi, Kapisa, Panjsher, Sar-e-Pul, Takhar, Urozgan, Badakhshan, Faryab, Logar and Zabul) by 2022. To increase the coverage and quality of antiretroviral therapy services for people living with HIV by 2023. To detect and treat at least 50% of the estimated latent TB cases as the accumulation by 2025. Preventing the re-establishment of local malaria transmission due to importation in all areas where it has been eliminated. To strengthen capacity and systems to generate strategic information on HIV, STIs and Hepatitis through biological and behavior surveillance, surveys and research for evidence-based response to the HIV, STIs and Hepatitis epidemic. To increase access of women and children to health care services for RMNCAH, HIV, TB and malaria, reduced stigma and discrimination and promotion of health lifestyles in the community and in health facilities in underserved areas. To improve the enabling environment to address enhanced coordination, human rights, positive legal environment, strengthened community systems, increased domestic funding, reduced stigma and discrimination, to address the needs and rights of key populations affected by HIV, STIs and Hepatitis. To maintain and improve the quality of the National Laboratory Network. To improve institutional capacity of Civil Society Organizations and private sector for effective implementation of TB, Malaria and HIV. To ensure high quality pharmaceuticals and health commodities by strengthening the supply chain, procurement, management, Quality Assurance and regulatory systems. To improve the data quality of the HMIS and strengthen the utilization of data for decision-making at all levels

description.narrative: Living support to client/ target population (LSCTP)

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for AFG-Z-UNDP
Percentage of other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
SD-Other1: Number of people receiving services through Family Health Houses (FHHs)
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Percentage of TB patients with DST result for at least Rifampicin among the total number of notified (new and retreatment) cases in the same year
Number of needles and syringes distributed per person who injects drugs per year by needle and syringe programs

LAB-Other3: Percentage of provincial laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance among the total number of laboratories that undertake bacteriology services during the reporting period
Number of people in prisons or other closed settings that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at private sector sites
Number of people in prisons and other closed settings reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Number of people in contact with TB patients who began preventive therapy
HTS Other1: Percentage of WHRB hat have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Proportion of malaria cases (presumed and confirmed) that received first line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
SD-Other2: Number of people receiving services through Public-Private Partnerships (PPPs)
Percentage of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Proportion of malaria cases (presumed and confirmed) that received first line antimalarial treatment at private sector sites
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/ high risk groups (other than prisoners)
KP Other1: Percentage of WHRB reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Proportion of malaria cases (presumed and confirmed) that received first line antimalarial treatment in the community
Percentage of people who inject drugs that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results

LAB-Other2: Percentage of regional laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance among the total number of laboratories that undertake available services during the reporting period
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – private/non-governmental facilities
Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
Percentage of PLHIV on ART who initiated TB preventive therapy among those eligible during the reporting period
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
LAB-Other1: Laboratory functionality index
